content: 1. What does the price premium approach to measuring brand equity describe?

answers.text: a) The frequency of discount campaigns
b) The price consumers are willing to pay extra for a brand
c) The comparison of stock levels
d) The market share of competitors

content: 2. Which advantage is attributed to brands in the context of risk reduction?

answers.text: c) They stabilize cash flows through brand loyalty
d) They make investors more cautious

content: 3. What does the sales premium approach measure?

answers.text: a) The price elasticity of demand
b) The sales volume compared to unbranded products
d) The number of brand licenses
